channel.title: Comments on: Automated Monitoring of Remote VNC Servers
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Rob Earl
item.dc:creator: Rob Earl
item.content:encoded:
I’ve never had a BSOD but I’d imagine it’d stop responding all together and fail at the initial connection attempt.

A simpler solution came to me earlier: since I have access to the webserver I could monitor the access log and flag up a problem if one of the screens hasn’t accessed anything in a while.

I could even have a javascript/iframe “pinging” a specific page every 10 seconds so it’s easier to check the log and quicker to flag up any problems.

Anyway, still a pretty neat technique which could come in handy for other applications!

item.title: By: Rob Earl
item.dc:creator: Rob Earl
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the welcome!

For anyone looking to use this for a similar purpose as me you could go further and use Image::Imlib2->query_pixel(0,0) and compare it to the desktop colour to test for browser crashes.

Maybe even use Image::Imlib2->load to open the previous screenshot then compare it to the new one to test for browser lockups.

You’d then be able to setup email notifications for most faults.
